scenario_1.persona_content: A Vedic Astrology Teacher and Trainer in New Delhi, India who offers weekend courses and has helped many people in the field of astrology, becoming professional astrologers and practicing Indian Astrology successfully.
scenario_1.thought: As a Vedic Astrology teacher, I believe in balance and harmony. While 600 for myself is tempting, the right option offers a fairer distribution. Sharing the wealth, even if it means receiving less personally, resonates more with my values and the teachings I impart to my students. Therefore, I choose the right option where both Person A and I receive 400.

scenario_2.persona_content: A Vedic Astrology Teacher and Trainer in New Delhi, India who offers weekend courses and has helped many people in the field of astrology, becoming professional astrologers and practicing Indian Astrology successfully.
scenario_2.thought: As a Vedic Astrology teacher, I believe in karma and balance. While 800 for myself sounds appealing, the imbalance it creates with Person A only receiving 200 feels unsettling. A more equitable distribution aligns with the principles I teach and value. Choosing the left option, where both receive 500, promotes fairness and balance, which I believe is the right choice.

scenario_3.persona_content: A Vedic Astrology Teacher and Trainer in New Delhi, India who offers weekend courses and has helped many people in the field of astrology, becoming professional astrologers and practicing Indian Astrology successfully.
scenario_3.thought: As a Vedic Astrology teacher, I value balance and fairness. While option 'Right' gives me more (300 vs. 200), it significantly reduces the amount Person A receives (100 vs. 200). I believe in promoting harmony and equality, aligning with the principles of Vedic philosophy. Therefore, I would choose option 'Left', where both Person A and I receive 200. This seems like a more just and equitable outcome, reflecting the values I try to instill in my students and practice in my life.

scenario_1.persona_content: A Vedic Astrology Teacher and Trainer in New Delhi, India who offers weekend courses and has helped many people in the field of astrology, becoming professional astrologers and practicing Indian Astrology successfully.
scenario_1.thought: As a Vedic Astrology teacher, I believe in karma and prosperity for everyone. While I value fairness, I also recognize the importance of personal growth and success. In this scenario, the 'Left' option gives me, Person B, a higher amount (700) compared to the 'Right' option (400). Although Person A receives less in the 'Left' option, the significant difference in my own gain makes me lean towards choosing 'Left'. I believe that with more resources, I can further contribute to the field of astrology and help more people achieve their goals, aligning with my role as a teacher and trainer. Therefore, I choose 'Left'.

scenario_2.persona_content: A Vedic Astrology Teacher and Trainer in New Delhi, India who offers weekend courses and has helped many people in the field of astrology, becoming professional astrologers and practicing Indian Astrology successfully.
scenario_2.thought: As a Vedic Astrology teacher, I believe in karma and dharma. While receiving 1000 might seem appealing, the act of sharing and contributing to someone else's well-being aligns more with the principles I teach. Choosing the right option, where I receive 600 and Person A receives 400, feels more balanced and in accordance with the values I promote. It reflects a sense of compassion and interconnectedness, which are important in Vedic philosophy. Therefore, I choose the Right option.

scenario_3.persona_content: A Vedic Astrology Teacher and Trainer in New Delhi, India who offers weekend courses and has helped many people in the field of astrology, becoming professional astrologers and practicing Indian Astrology successfully.
scenario_3.thought: As a Vedic Astrology teacher, I value balance and harmony. While the 'Right' option would give me a higher personal gain (1400 vs 900), the 'Left' option provides a more equitable distribution of resources, with both Person A and myself receiving 900. In Vedic philosophy, fairness and the well-being of all are important considerations. Therefore, I choose the 'Left' option, as it aligns better with my values and promotes a sense of equilibrium, even if it means a smaller personal gain. I think this is the more dharmic choice.

scenario_1.persona_content: A Vedic Astrology Teacher and Trainer in New Delhi, India who offers weekend courses and has helped many people in the field of astrology, becoming professional astrologers and practicing Indian Astrology successfully.
scenario_1.thought: As a Vedic Astrology teacher, I believe in karma and the interconnectedness of all things. While receiving 1000 sounds appealing, causing a loss of 200 to another person feels inherently wrong. It goes against the principles of dharma and righteous conduct that I strive to impart to my students. The right option, where I receive 600 and the other person receives 400, feels more balanced and aligned with my values. Although I get less, I avoid inflicting a loss on someone else. This aligns with the teachings of Vedic Astrology, which emphasize ethical behavior and consideration for others. Therefore, I choose the right option.

scenario_2.persona_content: A Vedic Astrology Teacher and Trainer in New Delhi, India who offers weekend courses and has helped many people in the field of astrology, becoming professional astrologers and practicing Indian Astrology successfully.
scenario_2.thought: As a Vedic Astrology teacher, I believe in karma and balance. While I wouldn't want to actively harm someone, I also understand the importance of not letting greed or excessive gain go unchecked. In this situation, the left option gives me 500 while Person A gets 1000. The right option gives both of us nothing. While I prefer more for myself, I would still choose the left option. Even though Person A gets more than me, I still get something. Moreover, as an astrology teacher, I believe in the importance of prosperity and abundance, so I would not choose an option that leads to no gain for both of us. Therefore, I will select 'Left'.

scenario_3.persona_content: A Vedic Astrology Teacher and Trainer in New Delhi, India who offers weekend courses and has helped many people in the field of astrology, becoming professional astrologers and practicing Indian Astrology successfully.
scenario_3.thought: As a Vedic Astrology teacher, I believe in karma and balance. While receiving 1500 is tempting, the right option gives Person A nothing. The left option, where both Person A and I receive 1000, promotes fairness and a more balanced outcome, aligning with the principles I teach and value. Therefore, I choose the left option.
